body_html:
@drpngx , @ebrevdo , Found the cause of failure of this test.
Looks like the precision is lost here.

When I changed the dtype from float32 to float64 as below, the test passed.

               inputs = constant_op.constant(
-                  input_values, shape=input_shape, dtype=dtypes.float32)
+                  input_values, shape=input_shape, dtype=dtypes.float64)

I also tried the same on x86, and it's still passing.

Is it OK to create a PR with this change?
body_text:

               inputs = constant_op.constant(

body:
@drpngx , @ebrevdo , Found the cause of failure of this test.
Looks like the precision is lost [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v1.4.1/tensorflow/python/ops/nn_test.py#L878).

When I changed the dtype from float32 to float64 as below, the test passed.
```
               inputs = constant_op.constant(
-                  input_values, shape=input_shape, dtype=dtypes.float32)
+                  input_values, shape=input_shape, dtype=dtypes.float64)
```

I also tried the same on x86, and it's still passing.

Is it OK to create a PR with this change?
